title: 108_hr1617
content: The "National Rail Infrastructure Program Act" establishes a program to provide grants for projects addressing railroad infrastructure deficiencies to benefit the public by reducing traffic congestion, transportation emissions, energy usage, and improving railroad operations. Eligible projects will be determined by the Secretary of Transportation. Projects eligible for funding under the "National Rail Infrastructure Program Act" include increasing track capacity, acquiring rights-of-way, improving rail-road crossings, integrating railroad systems, and track construction and repair. Funding cannot be used for operating expenses, rolling stock acquisition, debt payment, or certain construction projects. Projects must be included in long-range transportation plans, state plans, or transportation improvement programs to be funded. SEC. 104 of the "National Rail Infrastructure Program Act" requires 20% of project costs to be covered by non-Federal public sources. SEC. 105 outlines the allocation of funds. SEC. 105 of the "National Rail Infrastructure Program Act" allocates funds for grants to States based on a formula considering rail miles, rail cars loaded and unloaded, and grade crossings. The Secretary of Transportation will provide 80% of the funds to States and use 20% for grants to projects of national significance with public benefit emphasis. SEC. 106 of the "National Rail Infrastructure Program Act" mandates that laborers and mechanics on construction projects funded under this title must be paid prevailing wages. SEC. 107 requires at least 10% of funds to be spent on small businesses owned by disadvantaged individuals. SEC. 108 provides definitions for terms used in the Act. SEC. 108 of the "National Rail Infrastructure Program Act" defines "rail miles" as route miles and "railroad" as freight, intercity passenger, and commuter rail transportation. SEC. 201 imposes an excise tax on the sale of certain train equipment. A 5% tax is imposed on the sale of specified railroad equipment, including locomotives and rolling stock. Additionally, a 5% tax is imposed on the installation of parts or accessories on such equipment within 6 months of it being placed in service, unless it is a replacement part or accessory. A 5% tax is imposed on specified railroad equipment sales and installation of parts or accessories within 6 months, except for replacements. Installers are secondarily liable for the tax. The amendments made by this section regarding the tax on rail transportation of persons or property will take effect on October 1, 2003. This includes the imposition of a 5% or 10% tax on taxable rail transportation of persons, with specific rates for commuter rail and other cases. SEC. 4242. TRANSPORTATION OF PROPERTY. A 1% tax is imposed on amounts paid for taxable rail transportation of property within or outside the United States. The tax applies to payments made to a person engaged in the business of transporting property by rail for hire. The tax is to be paid by the person making the payment subject to tax, except in cases where payments are made outside the United States, in which the tax is to be paid by the person furnishing the last segment of the taxable transportation. The 1% tax is imposed on payments for taxable rail transportation of property within or outside the United States, to be paid by the person making the payment subject to tax. For taxable rail transportation within the United States, excluding mass transit, the tax is imposed on payments made outside the U.S. for prepaid orders. Refunds for tickets purchased without tax payment must deduct the tax due under section 4241. The tax imposed under section 4241 must be paid at the time of transportation purchase. If the tax is not collected, the carrier providing the initial segment of transportation in the U.S. is responsible for paying it. SEC. 203. NATIONAL RAIL INFRASTRUCTURE PROGRAM TRUST FUND. The amendments made by this section shall take effect on October 1, 2003. Subchapter A of chapter 98 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by adding a new section for the National Rail Infrastructure Program Trust Fund. The National Rail Infrastructure Program Trust Fund is established in the Treasury of the United States, funded by taxes on railroad locomotives, customs duties, fuel taxes, and royalties from oil or gas extraction on Federal lands. The Trust Fund is available for expenditures to carry out title I of the program. The National Rail Infrastructure Program Trust Fund is established in the Treasury of the United States for making expenditures to carry out title I of the program. A clerical amendment is made to the table of sections for the subchapter. The National Rail Infrastructure Program Trust Fund is established in the Treasury of the United States for making expenditures to carry out title I of the program.
